meanings.definition: A store where loans are made in exchange for personal property as security.
meanings.sent1: I went to the pawnshop to borrow money by leaving my watch as security.
meanings.sent2: My friend found a valuable ring at the pawnshop.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cat go to the pawnshop? To pawn its collar for some treats!
meanings.sent4: In the game of life, sometimes we all feel like items in a pawnshop waiting to be redeemed.
meanings.sent5: The pawnshop was filled with all sorts of interesting items, each with its own story.

meanings.definition: To deposit personal property as security for a loan at a pawnshop.
meanings.sent1: I had to pawnshop my guitar to get some quick cash.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pawnshop her necklace for some extra money.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to pawnshop its acorns for a loan, but the pawnshop owner was not interested.
meanings.sent4: His memories were pawnshopped away in exchange for temporary relief.
meanings.sent5: As the storm approached, he had no choice but to pawnshop his prized possession for shelter.
